morfologik.tools

Class SequenceEncoders.TrimPrefixAndSuffixEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • morfologik.tools.SequenceEncoders.TrimPrefixAndSuffixEncoder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SequenceEncoders.IEncoder
    Enclosing class:
    SequenceEncoders

    public static class SequenceEncoders.TrimPrefixAndSuffixEncoder
extends java.lang.Object
implements SequenceEncoders.IEncoder
    Encodes dst relative to src by trimming whatever non-equal suffix and prefix src and dst have. The output code is (bytes): 
     {P}{K}{suffix}
    where (P - 'A') bytes should be trimmed from the start of src, (K - 'A') bytes should be trimmed from the end of src and then the suffix should be appended to the resulting byte sequence.

    Examples:

     src: abc
 dst: abcd
 encoded: AAd
 
 src: abc
 dst: xyz
 encoded: ADxyz

    Note: Each code's length is a single byte. If any is equal to SequenceEncoders.REMOVE_EVERYTHING the entire src sequence should be discarded.
